channel.title: Opel Calibra
channel.description:
In about 6 months I'll be 18, and I'm allowed to get driving license.
I have a great job, pretty many tools and passion for tuning a car. I started searching for all kind of cheap "sport cars", mostly coupes. And I won't need like 200hp engine, im fine with 100-150hp.
Because it's my first car, I won't use much money on CAR, but I'll probably get some nice audio equipment and stuff like that, so I can sell the car without them. Then I found Opel Calibra, it has just ideal amount of HP (I would like 16V version better ofc :D ), it looks pretty cool (even without any modding!) and the best thing is; it's not really expensive. In Finland I can get a good one for about 2500 euros.
I will probably spend about 1000 euros for rims, audio, bodykit and stuff like that.
So what are your experiences with Calibra? Pros and cons? Anything I need to know about it? And I must say, I haven't heard many good things about Opels, pretty much only bad things.

item.title: Opel Calibra
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

It’s a great car, my brother planned to buy one. The looks are awesome, but there is one problem. The bottom plate gets rusted quite quick. I had a wet ass when I sat in the back seat, so that will be a problem. We went to a car mechanic (a family member) and he said that a new bottom plate was needed, wich would cost quite a bit. So the deal went off, but if you can do it yourself I’d go for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Opel Calibra
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Looks hot. Too bad I live in America.

Read full topic
